intro: Acosta boissieri subsp. calvescens, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils in open habitats. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from spring to summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
